comments:
In the "New webservice" or "New webservice client" wizard the Next/Finish buttons are enabled if the slider for the level of webservice or client implementation is moved (or just touched).
The input validation is not triggered. If I did not enter a WSDL file for a Bottom Up Webservice I can click "Next" now and the result is an exception dialog.
I will attach a screenshot to show what I mean.

The exception dialog contains this message (which by the way is not entered in the ".log" file):

Wizard "New webservice" with enabled Next button

Wolfgang, thanks - I've tried this scenario and a few permutations on it, and cannot reproduce it on the latest WTP Web services tools from HEAD, which pretty much matches what's coming in this week's integration build. We've been working vigorously on cleaning up the behaviour of page 1, especially wrt. validation. If you see this problem again on the coming integration build (or later), please reopen this bug and we'll have another look.

Thanks - CB.

Verified against wtp-I-I200604272112-200604272112.zip: everything fine now.

Thanks for fixing it.
